events.title: Hiram Bingham Rediscovered Machu Picchu
events.description: American historian and explorer Hiram Bingham III brought international attention to the ancient Incan city of Machu Picchu in Peru, which had been largely unknown to the outside world.
events.significance: The discovery highlighted the cultural and historical importance of the Incan civilization and led to increased archaeological research and tourism in the Andes.

events.title: Liberation of Paris During World War II
events.description: Paris was liberated from German occupation by the French 2nd Armored Division and the U.S. 4th Infantry Division, aided by the French Resistance.
events.significance: A major turning point in World War II, the liberation restored French sovereignty and symbolized the collapse of Nazi control in Western Europe.

events.title: Hawaii Becomes 50th U.S. State
events.description: Hawaii was officially admitted as the 50th state of the United States, expanding the nation's territory into the Pacific Ocean.
events.significance: Statehood marked an important expansion of American political and cultural influence, integrating a unique and diverse region into the U.S. federation.

events.title: People Power Revolution Ends Marcos Regime in the Philippines
events.description: Following a series of protests and political pressure, Ferdinand Marcos fled the Philippines, ending his 20-year dictatorship and restoring democracy under Corazon Aquino.
events.significance: This peaceful revolution inspired similar democratic movements worldwide and restored democratic governance in the Philippines.
